books.title: Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus
books.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
books.summary: One of the most important texts of 20th century philosophy, in which the nature of the philosophy, language, understanding, and logical atomism are explored.

books.title: Bellarion the Fortunate
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: An orphan develops his talents in intrigue, romance, and war in fifteenth-century Italy.

books.title: A Daughter of the Samurai
books.author: Etsu Inagaki Sugimoto
books.summary: The autobiography of Etsu Sugimoto, a girl born into a samurai family in a time of great cultural changes.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Just William
books.author: Richmal Crompton
books.summary: An eleven-year old English boy gets involved in a continuous series of amusing adventures to the exasperation of his long-suffering family.

books.title: A Prefect’s Uncle
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s life at boarding school is disrupted by an uncle that he’s never met before.

books.title: Othello
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Jealousy destroys the marriage between an older black man and a younger white woman in 1500s Venice.

books.title: Lady Into Fox
books.author: David Garnett
books.summary: A newly-married young woman is suddenly transformed into a fox, to the consternation and enduring grief of her husband.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: Ghost Stories
books.author: E. F. Benson
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories by E. F. Benson.

books.title: Seven Pillars of Wisdom
books.author: T. E. Lawrence
books.summary: T. E. Lawrence’s memoir of leading the Arab revolt against the Ottoman empire during World War I.

books.title: The Secret Adversary
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: Tommy and Tuppence try to solve a mystery, only to find themselves embroiled in schemes of murder, millionaires, and diplomats.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: The Genealogy of Morals
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.summary: Three essays analyzing the origins, meaning, and value of the concepts of good, evil, and bad; of guilt, punishment, and bad conscience; and of ascetic ideals, including those of truth and truthfulness.

books.title: The Columbiad
books.author: Joel Barlow
books.summary: Columbus is shown a history of the western hemisphere since his discoveries.

books.title: Point Counter Point
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: Several connected stories are interwoven to create a satirical look at English society.

books.title: Triplanetary
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: In a universe where all powerful alien races influence the fates of worlds, a war erupts between the Triplanetary League of the inner solar system, pirates led by a mysterious and malicious scientist, and technologically advanced aliens.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: A collection of all of the short stories and novellas written by Leo Tolstoy.

books.title: The Imitation of Christ
books.author: Thomas à Kempis
books.summary: Thomas à Kempis provides instructions for a Christian spiritual life.

books.title: On a Chinese Screen
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short vignettes about the people and places W. Somerset Maugham encountered during his travels along the Yangtze River in 1919–20.
